sentence.Network_en: digital terrestrial and digital satellite broadcasting
sentence.Network_cn: 数字陆上广播和数字卫星广播

sentence.Network_en: The gills of fishes are analogous to the lungs in terrestrial animals.
sentence.Network_cn: 鱼类的鳃与陆上动物的肺类似.

sentence.Network_en: Newton proposed that heavenly and terrestrial motion could be unified with the idea of gravity.
sentence.Network_cn: 牛顿提出天体和地球的运动可以用万有引力来解释。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'temporal, worldly, mundane'): from Latin terrestris (from terra 'earth') + -al

entry.tran: (动植物)陆地的，陆生的，陆栖的
entry.def: A terrestrial animal or plant lives on land or on the ground rather than in the sea, in trees, or in the air.

example.ex: Terrestrial and aquatic fauna may sometimes be found resting together under a loose stone.
example.tran: 有时在松动的石头下可以同时看见栖息的陆生动物和水生动物。

entry.def: Terrestrial means relating to the planet Earth rather than to some other part of the universe.

example.tran: 地球上的各种生命形态

entry.tran: (电视频道)地面的(有别于卫星转播的)
entry.def: Terrestrial television channels are transmitted using equipment situated at ground level, and not by satellite.

means.word_mean: 1. of or relating to or inhabiting the land as opposed to the sea or air
2. of or relating to or characteristic of the planet Earth or its inhabitants;
3. operating or living or growing on land
4. concerned with the world or worldly matters;

sentences.sentence: "the nearest to an angelic being that treads this terrestrial ball"

auth_sentence.content: Numerous molluscs also live in freshwater and terrestrial habitats.
auth_sentence.res_content: Numerous molluscs also live in freshwater and terrestrial habitats.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Numerous molluscs also live in freshwater and terrestrial habitats.

auth_sentence.content: It is omnivorous and the most terrestrial of lemurs.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is omnivorous and the most terrestrial of lemurs.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is omnivorous and the most terrestrial of lemurs.

auth_sentence.content: Terrestrial life was well established by the Carboniferous period.
auth_sentence.res_content: Terrestrial life was well established by the Carboniferous period.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Terrestrial life was well established by the Carboniferous period.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =earth,表示"土地"; 2. =frighten,可怕,恐惧; 3. =frighten,表示"恐,怕"

stems_affixes.value_cn: [comeing from]地球外的, 宇宙的[outside the earth]
stems_affixes.word_buile: extra外+terrestrial[adj.地球的，地球上的]→adj.[comeing from]地球外的, 宇宙的[outside the earth]
mediterranean而来→n.地中海 adj.地中海的
subterrane[n.下层; 洞穴, 地下室]+ean→adj.地下的
terr土地+estrial→adj.地球的，地球上的
territory[n.领土;版图;领域,范围]+ial……的→territorial领土的
deter[v.威慑,吓住]+ent……的→deterrent威慑的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 很糟的;可怕的,骇人的;极度的,厉害的
stems_affixes.word_buile: terr恐,怕+ible可..的→可怕的
terr恐,怕+ific产生……的→带来可怕→好到让人可怕的地步→极好的
extra外+territorial[adj.领土的,土地的,地方的]+ity表名词→n.治外法权
mediterranean而来→n.地中海 adj.地中海的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 下层; 洞穴, 地下室
stems_affixes.word_buile: sub下面+terr土地+ane→n.下层; 洞穴, 地下室
terr土地+ace→n.平台,阳台,露台
terr土地+ain表名词→n.地势,地形
terr土地+it+ory场所,范围→地的范围,领土
deter[v.威慑,吓住]+ment表名词→n.制止

stems_affixes.value_cn: 恐怖, 可怕的人, 恐怖时期, 恐怖行动
stems_affixes.word_buile: terr恐,怕+or表名词→n.恐怖, 可怕的人, 恐怖时期, 恐怖行动
terror恐怖+ist人→n.恐怖分子
dis离,出+inter埋→v.挖出,掘土
in进+ter=terr土地→v.埋葬
de去+ter=terr恐,怕→吓跑了,吓得不动了
terr恐,怕+ify使……→v.使害怕,使惊恐

sentences.en: Terrestrial longitude is measured in degrees east or west of the Greenwich meridian.
sentences.cn: 地球的经度是用格林尼治子午线向东或向西的度数来表示的。

means.word_mean: 陆地的;陆上的;陆栖的;陆生的

sentences.en: In rugby circles, there is nothing but criticism for the coverage of sport on terrestrial TV.
sentences.cn: 橄榄球界对于地面无线电视对他们运动的报道只有批评意见。
